text:
<@UUTL3EKN3> and community for Pluto
Its a beautiful piece of software! I never knew I how much I needed it, before stumbling upon it!
Also, <@UC6SUUPRC>, <@UCD4Z3NJZ> and <@UDB26738Q> for keeping up with my annoying pestering and helping me out! I've certainly grown a lot in 2020 because of the above names!

elements.text:
and community for Pluto
Its a beautiful piece of software! I never knew I how much I needed it, before stumbling upon it!
Also,
for keeping up with my annoying pestering and helping me out! I've certainly grown a lot in 2020 because of the above names!

text: Let me add a note of appreciation for making Pluto opinionated, and not backing down. On discourse it seems that many people can imagine a tool half way between Jupyter and where Pluto is today, which would avoid some pain points and be more useful to them right now. But I think it’s more interesting to see where Pluto’s own orbit takes it.

text: I think most of the pain in that thread comes from people thinking of Pluto as a drop-in replacement for Jupyter, when it's not

elements.text: I think most of the pain in that thread comes from people thinking of Pluto as a drop-in replacement for Jupyter, when it's not

text:
I think it’s fine for people to want different things.
and in that case it is actually *good* if the different tools have opinionated takes on what their thing is.
That makes it easier to chose between them.

if the different tools have opinionated takes on what their thing is.

text: it's opinionated because julia doesn't run fast in untyped global scope - just changing the tool and not one's workflow is bound to lead to problems, but that's just my POV

elements.text: it's opinionated because julia doesn't run fast in untyped global scope - just changing the tool and not one's workflow is bound to lead to problems, but that's just my POV

text: Yes, many parallel arguments about Julia itself, “why can’t it do what I already do?” Re global scope precisely, Pluto #720 wraps everything in functions, which seems a nice example of moving away from being just a repl in the browser.
